metadata.title: CVE-2024-27436 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:usb-audio: Stop parsing channels bits when all channels are found. If a usbaudio device sets more bits than the amount of channels it could writeoutside of the map array.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-260.294').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1138.148').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1175.190').
linux-aws-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
